name: DeathSpank
description: For uncounted years, DeathSpank has been a Dispenser of Justice, a Vanquisher of Evil, and a Hero to the Downtrodden. DeathSpank has long searched for a powerful artifact called….The Artifact. Forged by unknown hands for unknown purposes some unknown time in the past, The Artifact is now within DeathSpank’s reach. What is The Artifact?
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7 Processor: Intel Pentium 4 (or equivalent with SSE2 support) running at 1.7 GHz or greater Memory: 1 GB of ram, 1.5 GB (Vista and Windows 7) Hard Disk Space: at least 2 GB of free HD space Video Card: ATI Radeon X1900 GT 256MB and the Nvidia GeForce 6800 Ultra 256MB cards; Shader 2.0 and 24 bit depth buffer support required DirectX®: DirectX9 Jun 2010 Local co-op requirements: A controller is required for the second player

reviews.review_text: 'Diablo 2 meets Monkey Island?' Not so sure about that--but DeathSpank may just be Guybrush's heroic (albeit slightly slow) cousin, sword-spinning his way to defeating evil Lord von Prong. Plenty of bad guys, loot, and, uh, snacks await you on this epic quest. Environments, items and enemies offer plenty of variety. In terms of replayability, there is not much to be had there--although the game may be worth revisiting after a year or two have passed. Multiplayer feels like an afterthought, but it is actually possible to have an (offline) friend assist you at all times. For your money, you're looking at around 6 to 10 hours of gameplay (depending on how you play it and if you want to do all the side quests). You decide if it's worth it. While you're at it, you might want to buy the sequels (DeathSpank: Thongs of Virtue and The Baconing) along with this game, or else the ending (or lack thereof) may disappoint you. For me, the verdict is clear: It's great.  Works flawlessly in WINE, too.
7/10 - Think of a shorter Diablo/Torchlight (about 10 hours playtime) with a sense of humour and you've got DeathSpank.
One of the most funny RPGs ! I highly recommend to RPG fans!

DeathSpank. The name of the protagonist says it all. This game is all about the story and the very entertaining voice acting. The fourth wall is broken repeatedly as means of telling the story. The gameplay is somewhat clunky in combat on PC, where mouse cursor adjusts where you are facing - meaning you may suddenly expose DeathSpanks back to attack when you just want to move past an enemy slightly. Still, this game is worth some time just for the dialogue.

Very funny dialogue in this game. Totally reminds of 'The Tick' and Big Blue Justice!!! Had me laughing out loud to start with, but did get old, but still humorous after playing through to finish the game. The controls and use of all of the XBOX type control options are done well. Game flows and is pretty easy up until the final battle. Funny desctiptions of all of the wepaons and other items in the game as well. Battles became a little monotonous, but didn't detract too much from the game as it goes by quickly. Very good game that I highly recommend to fans of Tick type humor.

Have only played it for a 10 or so minutes (and that includes watching the intro video) but I absolutely love the game so far! Love the humour and the graphic style. Looking forward to dedicating some time to actual playing it now.
Short (8 hours) game that has a lot of crude humor. Worth the play
great game.

'So I hear you are good at killing the dead!' :P  Simple combat, questing and role playing... but loads of fun! Quirky sense of humour, and some nice satirical twists to the usual action RPG elements! :)  Looks awesome in stereo 3D too! :D
I love it! Very funny and entertaining, couldn't stop playing. Great great RPG that makes fun of the usual RPGs XD
I love this game. I really enjoy the comments. It is a no brainer, Escapism from Realityism. Go DeathSpank
Diablo, with a very Earthworm Jim / The Tick styled sense of humour. The looting isn't all that great, with pretty much no randomness, but Deathspank himself is GLORIOUS.
I like games that have their unique style. DeathSpank has humor, cartoonish atmosphere, exceptional art style and beautiful dialogues.
DeathSpank is a definite must-have for any RPG / Action-Adventure game fan. Lots of humour and fun to play, DeathSpank is worth every penny spent.

DeathSpank is a joy to play. The comedy is great. The items, quests, and other mechanics aren't overly complicated and make this RPG a lot of fun. There are a lot of side quests to complete (I think around 115 quests total including main/side quests) and you'll want to finish all of them.  It's mixture of cartoony 3D and 2D graphics around a curving world is a nice change from typical RPGs. It's also shorter than many others, as it can easily be 100% finished in 10-12 hours. Which, to me, isn't a bad thing at all. It isn't too short, and it isn't so long that you get bored and burned out by the end. If you're a fan of RPGs, I definitely recommend it.
This is a little fun game. No brainer @ $5 on sale. well worth a cup of coffee.

Deathspank is loaded with fetch-quests, sometimes to a ridiculous extent. One quest giver sends you to the same place, to fetch one item at a time, at least a half dozen times. It's obviously tongue-in-cheek, but the irony wouldn't wear so thin if it didn't apply to most of the game. Also, it's sometimes unclear what you are supposed to do. You will probably find yourself hitting the online guides two or three times. I wouldn't recommend it for a hard core RPG or action player. However, Deathspank is a solid, funny local coop game if you play with someone younger, and it works much better with the gamepad than first-person games do. My seven year old had a blast playing it with me. If you are okay with exposing a kid to cartoonish violence and some mildly crude humor, and don't feel an obsessive need to slogh through every sidequest, you should give it a shot.
This Game is hilariously funny. Great Action RPG which pokes fun at every other RPG, especially the dialogues make this Game so worthwhile.
Parody of hack and slash games mixed with a bit of adventure game elements. Great fun with pal thought that requires a controller.
Wicked addicting and fun. Didnt experience any glitches or bugs, which doesnt happen often these days. Hilarious story and characters. Good choice if you need a laugh!

A tad short, and it crashes on occasion for reasons that have not been fully explained, but it's pretty fun for those of you who like humor and also Diablo style games. I'd wait until it goes on sale again before buying though.

If you've play diabalo 1/2 and torchlight 1 you might find this easy to pick up it has the same system point and click with awsd movment. Has some humor that sometimes gets annoying after a while when death spank repeats some of his line. Combat is pretty simple point n click an enimie till they've dead.   Graphics it's a 3d word with 2d models gives it a pop up book effect really coloufull surroundings, the story is pretty flat just have to find items for the next quest or though it doesn't hinder the games over all score of 67/100 not great but playable.

Some things that happened when i played this games include: giggling, snorting, farting, laughing outloud, gasping at jokes and having alot of fun playing. did get a little tedious by the end but well worth my time. The lolz are genuine.
A silly, silly game, and so much fun with it. All the usual trappings of an action rug wrapped up in a Ron Gilbert adventure. Perfect casual monster whacking antics
One of the funniest games I've ever played. Great story, art style and simply and fun combat. Awesome design.
It's a great, humorous game in the style of Torchlight and Diablo II. For the price, it's a must-play!

Deathspank is an action/adventure role-playing game with sense of humor that's similar to older superhero cartoons/comics/games (think Spiderman & Freedom Force).  Pros:  + Graphic style / different kind of ARPG mechanic + Unique setting and unique locations you get to explore + Soundtrack + SFX + Voice acting + Progress is fun overall. New dialogue adds a lot to it and there are many weapon combinations you can use.   Cons:  - Not much to do for 2nd player in co-op - 1-Hitting enemies that can be hard to spot (or know of when it comes to giants) before it's too late.  - Sometimes in tight walkways enemies could block me from escaping (even suddenly lagged and appeared behind me). - Some enemies have attacks that make it hard to know when to perfectly block them.  - No way to immediately exit dialogue - You can't equip items with lower overall stats than your current ones. The game forces you to get rid of them. - The game has a lot of fetch quests where you backtrack a lot.. pair that with the same walking speed you always have and it's not very nice.  8/10
